pr_title: [PIE-1798] Priv RPC acceptance tests with stub enclave.

timeline.message:
[PIE-1798] Added Privacy RPC ATs with stub enclave.

Signed-off-by: Mark Terry <mark.terry@consensys.net>

[PIE-1798] Added Privacy RPC ATs with stub enclave.

Signed-off-by: Mark Terry <mark.terry@consensys.net>

timeline.bodyText: nit: this can be a local var
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: Tests for priv_getTransactionCount, priv_getEeaTransactionCount and priv_call. Perhaps these are tested indirectly through other tests though?
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need a completableFuture here? Generally the ATs are written in synchronous way so that we perform some operation using node.execute and then node.verify to wait for the condition to succeed.
timeline.author: jframe

replies.bodyText: Incorrect fix for a test setup issue.  Removed.
replies.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: I think we can remove the Success from the end of all these conditions as that is the normal case.
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: No need for priv at the start of all the conditions, they are in the privConditions so it will be obvious these are in the priv namespace.
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: nit: can use the primitive int here
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: why do we need to check the instance type of the result?
timeline.author: jframe

replies.bodyText: Removed.
replies.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: Can we just check that status is 1 indicating it's successful?

replies.bodyText: It seems redundant, but I personally find it confusing without the extra Transaction and read the method being executed as priv_getPrivate
replies.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this change? It's not in the AT package, will this affect the priv_getPrivateTransaction rpc response?
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to change? Seems odd that we would be modifying classes in the API module for a AT unless there is a bug somewhere.
timeline.author: jframe

replies.bodyText: Good point.  Reverted and added a new response class in the AT package.
replies.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: added another comment about this, but would be good if we can avoid passing a future into the condition
timeline.author: jframe

timeline.bodyText: is this needed for this PR? I.e. does this PR make use of random vs signed Private Marker transactions?
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: The PR requires the signing account to have balance.
replies.author: mark-terry

replies.bodyText:
Not sure why this works in other places, but not now - maybe to do with Min-gas-price?
Will investigate other tests.
replies.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Updated BesuNodeFactory with an option to supply a mining configuration, which then permits setting the gasPrice to zero and mitigates the need for this change.
replies.author: mark-terry

timeline.bodyText: do you need to flag the tempFIle as "deleteOnExit"?
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Yep, great idea.  👍

timeline.bodyText: nit:_personally I'd rather see someone pass in a concrete privacyParameters, then this function can do a "Optional.ofNullable" - the person injecting the data doesn't (necessarily) want to have to construct up an Optional to make this work (unless this is invoked from a simple pass-through function)
timeline.author: rain-on

timeline.bodyText: nit: rename to end with ...withMultiTenantedPrivacy?
